00032 #define XNARCH_PASSTHROUGH_IRQS /*empty*/
00033 
00034 #define XNARCH_DEFAULT_TICK     1000000 /* ns, i.e. 1ms */
00035 #define XNARCH_HOST_TICK        (1000000000UL/HZ)
00036 
00037 #define XNARCH_THREAD_STACKSZ   4096
00038 
00039 #define xnarch_stack_size(tcb)  ((tcb)->stacksize)
00040 #define xnarch_user_task(tcb)   ((tcb)->user_task)
00041 
00042 struct xnthread;
00043 struct task_struct;
00044 
00045 typedef struct xnarchtcb {      /* Per-thread arch-dependent block */
00046 
00047     /* Kernel mode side */
00048 
00049 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU
00050     /* We only care for basic FPU handling in kernel-space; Altivec
00051        and SPE are not available to kernel-based nucleus threads. */
00052     rthal_fpenv_t fpuenv  __attribute__ ((aligned (16)));
00053     rthal_fpenv_t *fpup;        /* Pointer to the FPU backup area */
00054     struct task_struct *user_fpu_owner;
00055     /* Pointer the the FPU owner in userspace:
00056        - NULL for RT K threads,
00057        - last_task_used_math for Linux US threads (only current or NULL when MP)
00058        - current for RT US threads.
00059     */
00060 #define xnarch_fpu_ptr(tcb)     ((tcb)->fpup)
00061 #else /* !CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU */
00062 #define xnarch_fpu_ptr(tcb)     NULL
00063 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU */
00064 
00065     unsigned stacksize;         /* Aligned size of stack (bytes) */
00066     unsigned long *stackbase;   /* Stack space */
00067     unsigned long ksp;          /* Saved KSP for kernel-based threads */
00068     unsigned long *kspp;        /* Pointer to saved KSP (&ksp or &user->thread.ksp) */
00069 
00070     /* User mode side */
00071     struct task_struct *user_task;      /* Shadowed user-space task */
00072     struct task_struct *active_task;    /* Active user-space task */
00073 
00074     /* Init block */
00075     struct xnthread *self;
00076     int imask;
00077     const char *name;
00078     void (*entry)(void *cookie);
00079     void *cookie;
00080 
00081 } xnarchtcb_t;
00082 
00083 typedef struct xnarch_fltinfo {
00084 
00085     struct pt_regs *regs;
00086 
00087 } xnarch_fltinfo_t;
00088 
00089 #define xnarch_fault_trap(fi)  ((unsigned int)(fi)->regs->trap)
00090 #define xnarch_fault_code(fi)  ((fi)->regs->dar)
00091 #define xnarch_fault_pc(fi)    ((fi)->regs->nip)

00097 static inline void *xnarch_sysalloc (u_long bytes)
00098 
00099 {
00100 #if 0   /* FIXME: likely on-demand mapping bug here */
00101     if (bytes >= 128*1024)
00102         return vmalloc(bytes);
00103 #endif
00104 
00105     return kmalloc(bytes,GFP_KERNEL);
00106 }
00107 
00108 static inline void xnarch_sysfree (void *chunk, u_long bytes)
00109 
00110 {
00111 #if 0   /* FIXME: likely on-demand mapping bug here */
00112     if (bytes >= 128*1024)
00113         vfree(chunk);
00114     else
00115 #endif
00116         kfree(chunk);
00117 }

00119 static inline void xnarch_relay_tick (void)
00120 
00121 {
00122     rthal_irq_host_pend(ADEOS_TIMER_VIRQ);

00131 static inline int xnarch_start_timer (unsigned long ns,
00132                                       void (*tickhandler)(void))
00133 {
00134     return rthal_timer_request(tickhandler,ns);
00135 }

00137 static inline void xnarch_leave_root (xnarchtcb_t *rootcb)
00138 
00139 {
00140     adeos_declare_cpuid;
00141 
00142     adeos_load_cpuid();
00143 
00144     /* rthal_cpu_realtime is only tested for the current processor,
00145        and always inside a critical section. */
00146     __set_bit(cpuid,&rthal_cpu_realtime);
00147     /* Remember the preempted Linux task pointer. */
00148     rootcb->user_task = rootcb->active_task = rthal_current_host_task(cpuid);
00149 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU
00150     rootcb->user_fpu_owner = rthal_get_fpu_owner(rootcb->user_task);
00151     /* So that xnarch_save_fpu() will operate on the right FPU area. */
00152     rootcb->fpup = (rootcb->user_fpu_owner
00153                     ? (rthal_fpenv_t *)&rootcb->user_fpu_owner->thread.fpr[0]
00154                     : NULL);
00155 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU */
00156 }
00157 
00158 static inline void xnarch_enter_root (xnarchtcb_t *rootcb) {
00159     __clear_bit(xnarch_current_cpu(),&rthal_cpu_realtime);
00160 }
00161 
00162 static inline void xnarch_switch_to (xnarchtcb_t *out_tcb,
00163                                      xnarchtcb_t *in_tcb)
00164 {
00165     struct task_struct *prev = out_tcb->active_task;
00166     struct task_struct *next = in_tcb->user_task;
00167 
00168     in_tcb->active_task = next ?: prev;
00169 
00170     if (next && next != prev) /* Switch to new user-space thread? */
00171         {
00172         struct mm_struct *mm = next->active_mm;
00173 
00174         /* Switch the mm context.*/
00175 
00176 #ifdef CONFIG_ALTIVEC
00177         /* Don't rely on FTR fixups --
00178            they don't work properly in our context. */
00179         if (cur_cpu_spec[0]->cpu_features & CPU_FTR_ALTIVEC) {
00180             asm volatile (
00181                 "dssall;\n"
00182 #ifndef CONFIG_POWER4
00183                 "sync;\n"
00184 #endif
00185                 : : );
00186         }
00187 #endif /* CONFIG_ALTIVEC */
00188 
00189         next->thread.pgdir = mm->pgd;
00190         get_mmu_context(mm);
00191         set_context(mm->context,mm->pgd);
00192 
00193         /* _switch expects a valid "current" (r2) for storing
00194          * ALTIVEC and SPE state. */
00195         current = prev;
00196         _switch(&prev->thread, &next->thread);
00197 
00198         barrier();
00199         }
00200     else
00201         /* Kernel-to-kernel context switch. */
00202         rthal_switch_context(out_tcb->kspp,in_tcb->kspp);
00203 }
00204 
00205 static inline void xnarch_finalize_and_switch (xnarchtcb_t *dead_tcb,
00206                                                xnarchtcb_t *next_tcb)
00207 {
00208     xnarch_switch_to(dead_tcb,next_tcb);
00209 }
00210 
00211 static inline void xnarch_finalize_no_switch (xnarchtcb_t *dead_tcb)
00212 
00213 {
00214     /* Empty */
00215 }
00216 
00217 static inline void xnarch_init_root_tcb (xnarchtcb_t *tcb,
00218                                          struct xnthread *thread,
00219                                          const char *name)
00220 {
00221     tcb->user_task = current;
00222     tcb->active_task = NULL;
00223     tcb->ksp = 0;
00224     tcb->kspp = &tcb->ksp;
00225 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU
00226     tcb->user_fpu_owner = NULL;
00227     tcb->fpup = NULL;
00228 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU */
00229     tcb->entry = NULL;
00230     tcb->cookie = NULL;
00231     tcb->self = thread;
00232     tcb->imask = 0;
00233     tcb->name = name;
00234 }
00235 
00236 asmlinkage static void xnarch_thread_trampoline (xnarchtcb_t *tcb)
00237 
00238 {
00239     rthal_local_irq_restore(!!tcb->imask);
00240     xnpod_welcome_thread(tcb->self);
00241     tcb->entry(tcb->cookie);
00242     xnpod_delete_thread(tcb->self);
00243 }
00244 
00245 static inline void xnarch_init_thread (xnarchtcb_t *tcb,
00246                                        void (*entry)(void *),
00247                                        void *cookie,
00248                                        int imask,
00249                                        struct xnthread *thread,
00250                                        char *name)
00251 {
00252     unsigned long *ksp, flags;
00253 
00254     adeos_hw_local_irq_flags(flags);
00255 
00256     *tcb->stackbase = 0;
00257     ksp = (unsigned long *)((((unsigned long)tcb->stackbase + tcb->stacksize - 0x10) & ~0xf) - RTHAL_SWITCH_FRAME_SIZE);
00258     tcb->ksp = (unsigned long)ksp - STACK_FRAME_OVERHEAD;
00259     ksp[19] = (unsigned long)tcb; /* r3 */
00260     ksp[25] = (unsigned long)&xnarch_thread_trampoline; /* lr */
00261     ksp[26] = flags & ~(MSR_EE | MSR_FP); /* msr */
00262 
00263     tcb->entry = entry;
00264     tcb->cookie = cookie;
00265     tcb->self = thread;
00266     tcb->imask = imask;
00267     tcb->name = name;
00268 }
00269 
00270 static inline void xnarch_enable_fpu (xnarchtcb_t *current_tcb)
00271 
00272 {
00273 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU
00274     if(!current_tcb->user_task)
00275         rthal_enable_fpu();
00276 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU */
00277 }
00278 
00279 static inline void xnarch_init_fpu (xnarchtcb_t *tcb)
00280 
00281 {
00282 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU
00283     /* Initialize the FPU for an emerging kernel-based RT thread. This
00284        must be run on behalf of the emerging thread. */
00285     memset(&tcb->fpuenv,0,sizeof(tcb->fpuenv));
00286     rthal_init_fpu(&tcb->fpuenv);
00287 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU */
00288 }
00289 
00290 static inline void xnarch_save_fpu (xnarchtcb_t *tcb)
00291 
00292 {
00293 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU
00294 
00295     if(tcb->fpup)
00296         {
00297         rthal_save_fpu(tcb->fpup);
00298 
00299         if(tcb->user_fpu_owner && tcb->user_fpu_owner->thread.regs)
00300             tcb->user_fpu_owner->thread.regs->msr &= ~MSR_FP;
00301         }   
00302 
00303 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU */
00304 }
00305 
00306 static inline void xnarch_restore_fpu (xnarchtcb_t *tcb)
00307 
00308 {
00309 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU
00310 
00311     if(tcb->fpup)
00312         {
00313         rthal_restore_fpu(tcb->fpup);
00314 
00315         if(tcb->user_fpu_owner && tcb->user_fpu_owner->thread.regs)
00316             tcb->user_fpu_owner->thread.regs->msr |= MSR_FP;
00317         }   
00318 
00319     /* FIXME: We restore FPU "as it was" when RTAI preempted Linux, whereas we
00320        could be much lazier. */
00321     if(tcb->user_task)
00322         rthal_disable_fpu();
00323 
00324 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU */
00325 }

00329 static inline int xnarch_send_ipi (xnarch_cpumask_t cpumask) {
00330 
00331     return adeos_send_ipi(ADEOS_SERVICE_IPI0, cpumask);
00332 }

00334 static inline int xnarch_hook_ipi (void (*handler)(void))
00335 
00336 {
00337     return adeos_virtualize_irq_from(&rthal_domain,
00338                                      ADEOS_SERVICE_IPI0,
00339                                      (void (*)(unsigned)) handler,
00340                                      NULL,
00341                                      IPIPE_HANDLE_MASK);
00342 }
00343 
00344 static inline int xnarch_release_ipi (void)
00345 
00346 {
00347     return adeos_virtualize_irq_from(&rthal_domain,
00348                                      ADEOS_SERVICE_IPI0,
00349                                      NULL,
00350                                      NULL,
00351                                      IPIPE_PASS_MASK);
00352 }

00355

00358     adeos_critical_exit(flags);
00359 }
00360 
00361 #else /* !CONFIG_SMP */

00363 static inline int xnarch_send_ipi (xnarch_cpumask_t cpumask)
00364 
00365 {
00366     return 0;
00367 }
00368 
00369 static inline int xnarch_hook_ipi (void (*handler)(void))
00370 
00371 {
00372     return 0;
00373 }
00374 
00375 static inline int xnarch_release_ipi (void)
00376 
00377 {
00378     return 0;
00379 }
00380 
00381 #define xnarch_notify_halt() /* Nullified */
00382 
00383 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00384 
00385 static inline void xnarch_notify_shutdown(void)
00386 
00387 {
00388 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00389     /* The HAL layer also sets the same CPU affinity so that both
00390        modules keep their execution sequence on SMP boxen. */
00391     set_cpus_allowed(current,cpumask_of_cpu(0));
00392 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00393 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_FUSION
00394     xnshadow_release_events();
00395 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_FUSION */
00396     /* Wait for the currently processed events to drain. */
00397     set_current_state(TASK_UNINTERRUPTIBLE);
00398     schedule_timeout(50);
00399     xnarch_release_ipi();
00400 }
00401 
00402 static inline int xnarch_escalate (void)
00403 
00404 {
00405     extern int xnarch_escalation_virq;
00406 
00407     if (adp_current == adp_root)
00408         {
00409         spl_t s;
00410         splsync(s);
00411         adeos_trigger_irq(xnarch_escalation_virq);
00412         splexit(s);
00413         return 1;
00414         }
00415 
00416     return 0;
00417 }
00418 
00419 static void xnarch_notify_ready (void)
00420 
00421 {
00422 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_FUSION
00423     xnshadow_grab_events();
00424 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_FUSION */
00425 }
00426 
00427 #endif /* XENO_POD_MODULE */

00429 #ifdef XENO_THREAD_MODULE
00430 
00431 static inline void xnarch_init_tcb (xnarchtcb_t *tcb) {
00432 
00433     tcb->user_task = NULL;
00434     tcb->active_task = NULL;
00435     tcb->kspp = &tcb->ksp;
00436 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU
00437     tcb->user_fpu_owner = NULL;
00438     tcb->fpup = &tcb->fpuenv;
00439 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU */
00440     /* Must be followed by xnarch_init_thread(). */
00441 }
00442 
00443 #endif /* XENO_THREAD_MODULE */
00444 
00445 #ifdef XENO_SHADOW_MODULE
00446 
00447 static inline void xnarch_init_shadow_tcb (xnarchtcb_t *tcb,
00448                                            struct xnthread *thread,
00449                                            const char *name)
00450 {
00451     struct task_struct *task = current;
00452 
00453     tcb->user_task = task;
00454     tcb->active_task = NULL;
00455     tcb->ksp = 0;
00456     tcb->kspp = &task->thread.ksp;
00457 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU
00458     tcb->user_fpu_owner = task;
00459     tcb->fpup = (rthal_fpenv_t *)&task->thread.fpr[0];
00460 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU */
00461     tcb->entry = NULL;
00462     tcb->cookie = NULL;
00463     tcb->self = thread;
00464     tcb->imask = 0;
00465     tcb->name = name;
00466 }
00467 
00468 static inline void xnarch_grab_xirqs (void (*handler)(unsigned irq))
00469 
00470 {
00471     unsigned irq;
00472 
00473     for (irq = 0; irq < IPIPE_NR_XIRQS; irq++)
00474         adeos_virtualize_irq(irq,
00475                              handler,
00476                              NULL,
00477                              IPIPE_DYNAMIC_MASK);
00478 
00479     /* On this arch, the decrementer trap is not an external IRQ but
00480        it is instead mapped to a virtual IRQ, so we must grab it
00481        individually. */
00482 
00483     adeos_virtualize_irq(ADEOS_TIMER_VIRQ,
00484                          handler,
00485                          NULL,
00486                          IPIPE_DYNAMIC_MASK);
00487 }
00488 
00489 static inline void xnarch_lock_xirqs (adomain_t *adp, int cpuid)
00490 
00491 {
00492     unsigned irq;
00493 
00494     for (irq = 0; irq < IPIPE_NR_XIRQS; irq++)
00495         {
00496         switch (irq)
00497             {
00498 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00499             case ADEOS_CRITICAL_IPI:
00500 
00501                 /* Never lock out this one. */
00502                 continue;
00503 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00504 
00505             default:
00506 
00507                 __adeos_lock_irq(adp,cpuid,irq);
00508             }
00509         }
00510 
00511     __adeos_lock_irq(adp,cpuid,ADEOS_TIMER_VIRQ);
00512 }
00513 
00514 static inline void xnarch_unlock_xirqs (adomain_t *adp, int cpuid)
00515 
00516 {
00517     unsigned irq;
00518 
00519     for (irq = 0; irq < IPIPE_NR_XIRQS; irq++)
00520         {
00521         switch (irq)
00522             {
00523 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00524             case ADEOS_CRITICAL_IPI:
00525 
00526                 continue;
00527 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00528 
00529             default:
00530 
00531                 __adeos_unlock_irq(adp,irq);
00532             }
00533         }
00534 
00535     __adeos_unlock_irq(adp,ADEOS_TIMER_VIRQ);
00536 }
00537 
00538 #endif /* XENO_SHADOW_MODULE */
00539 
00540 #ifdef XENO_TIMER_MODULE
00541 
00542 static inline void xnarch_program_timer_shot (unsigned long delay) {
00543     /* Even though some architectures may use a 64 bits delay here, we
00544        voluntarily limit to 32 bits, 4 billions ticks should be enough
00545        for now. Would a timer needs more, an extra call to the tick
00546        handler would simply occur after 4 billions ticks.  Since the
00547        timebase value is used to express CPU ticks on the PowerPC
00548        port, there is no need to rescale the delay value. */
00549     rthal_timer_program_shot(delay);
00550 }
00551 
00552 static inline void xnarch_stop_timer (void) {
00553     rthal_timer_release();
00554 }
00555 
00556 static inline int xnarch_send_timer_ipi (xnarch_cpumask_t mask)
00557 
00558 {
00559 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00560     return -1;          /* FIXME */
00561 #else /* ! CONFIG_SMP */
00562     return 0;
00563 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00564 }
00565 
00566 static inline void xnarch_read_timings (unsigned long long *shot,
00567                                         unsigned long long *delivery,
00568                                         unsigned long long defval)
00569 {
00570 #ifdef CONFIG_ADEOS_PROFILING
00571     int cpuid = adeos_processor_id();
00572     *shot = __adeos_profile_data[cpuid].irqs[__adeos_tick_irq].t_handled;
00573     *delivery = __adeos_profile_data[cpuid].irqs[__adeos_tick_irq].t_synced;
00574 #else /* !CONFIG_ADEOS_PROFILING */
00575     *shot = defval;
00576     *delivery = defval;
00577 #endif /* CONFIG_ADEOS_PROFILING */
00578 }
00579 
00580 #endif /* XENO_TIMER_MODULE */
00581 
00582 #ifdef XENO_MAIN_MODULE
00583 
00584 #include <linux/init.h>
00585 #include <nucleus/asm/calibration.h>
00586 
00587 extern u_long nkschedlat;
00588 
00589 extern u_long nktimerlat;
00590 
00591 int xnarch_escalation_virq;
00592 
00593 int xnpod_trap_fault(xnarch_fltinfo_t *fltinfo);
00594 
00595 void xnpod_schedule_handler(void);
00596 
00597 static rthal_trap_handler_t xnarch_old_trap_handler;
00598 
00599 static int xnarch_trap_fault (adevinfo_t *evinfo)
00600 
00601 {
00602     xnarch_fltinfo_t fltinfo;
00603     fltinfo.regs = (struct pt_regs *)evinfo->evdata;
00604     return xnpod_trap_fault(&fltinfo);
00605 }
00606 
00607 unsigned long xnarch_calibrate_timer (void)
00608 
00609 {
00610 #if CONFIG_RTAI_HW_TIMER_LATENCY != 0
00611     return xnarch_ns_to_tsc(CONFIG_RTAI_HW_TIMER_LATENCY) ?: 1;
00612 #else /* CONFIG_RTAI_HW_TIMER_LATENCY unspecified. */
00613     /* Compute the time needed to program the decrementer in aperiodic
00614        mode. The return value is expressed in timebase ticks. */
00615     return xnarch_ns_to_tsc(rthal_timer_calibrate()) ?: 1;
00616 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_HW_TIMER_LATENCY != 0 */
00617 }
00618 
00619 int xnarch_calibrate_sched (void)
00620 
00621 {
00622     nktimerlat = xnarch_calibrate_timer();
00623 
00624     if (!nktimerlat)
00625         return -ENODEV;
00626 
00627     nkschedlat = xnarch_ns_to_tsc(xnarch_get_sched_latency());
00628 
00629     return 0;
00630 }
00631 
00632 static inline int xnarch_init (void)
00633 
00634 {
00635     int err;
00636 
00637 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00638     /* The HAL layer also sets the same CPU affinity so that both
00639        modules keep their execution sequence on SMP boxen. */
00640     set_cpus_allowed(current,cpumask_of_cpu(0));
00641 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00642 
00643     err = xnarch_calibrate_sched();
00644 
00645     if (err)
00646         return err;
00647 
00648     xnarch_escalation_virq = adeos_alloc_irq();
00649 
00650     if (xnarch_escalation_virq == 0)
00651         return -ENOSYS;
00652 
00653     adeos_virtualize_irq_from(&rthal_domain,
00654                               xnarch_escalation_virq,
00655                               (void (*)(unsigned))&xnpod_schedule_handler,
00656                               NULL,
00657                               IPIPE_HANDLE_MASK);
00658 
00659     xnarch_old_trap_handler = rthal_trap_catch(&xnarch_trap_fault);
00660 
00661 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_FUSION
00662     err = xnshadow_mount();
00663 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_FUSION */
00664 
00665     if (err)
00666         {
00667         rthal_trap_catch(xnarch_old_trap_handler);
00668         adeos_free_irq(xnarch_escalation_virq);
00669         }
00670 
00671     return err;
00672 }
00673 
00674 static inline void xnarch_exit (void)
00675 
00676 {
00677 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_FUSION
00678     xnshadow_cleanup();
00679 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_FUSION */
00680     rthal_trap_catch(xnarch_old_trap_handler);
00681     adeos_free_irq(xnarch_escalation_virq);
00682 }
00683 
00684 #endif /* XENO_MAIN_MODULE */

00687 }
